poem:
**Electric Notes Dimmed**

Jeff's chords hang over Hyde Park,  
postponed by a whisper of fevered strings.  
Electric echoes dormant, health's overture,  
infections weave through music's veins.  

Fifty-five years, from first spark to quiet hum,  
farewell plugged into uncertainty's amp.  
ELO rests, unplayed symphony under London skies,  
over and out, the final note deferred.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jeff Lynne cancels final live show over health concerns Electric Light Orchestra (ELO) frontman Jeff Lynne has cancelled what had been billed as his final ever performance owing to ill health. Lynne was due to appear at the BST Hyde Park festival series on Sunday night, closing what had been the band’s farewell “Over and Out” tour, 55 years since the band formed. A spokesperson for the concerts said he had a “systemic infection”. They". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
